Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant with strong leaves and stems when depicted as having enough water and light.
The student can illustrate a plant with droopy or wilted leaves due to a lack of water.
The student can show a plant with pale or weak-looking leaves as a result of not receiving enough light.
The student can depict a plant thriving in sunlight, indicating the pattern that plants require light to live and grow.
CANNOT: The student might sometimes forget to depict one of the symptoms of a plant's lacking needs, such as leaves not drawn as droopy when the plant lacks water (inconsistent detail application).
The student may not clearly differentiate between the effects of a lack of water versus a lack of light at times, such as mixing up pale versus droopy leaves (minor confusion in specific symptoms).
